intro: Lepigonum capense, commonly known as the Cape lepigonum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy tissue, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a slightly serrated edge, and they are arranged alternately along the stem. Lepigonum capense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
